title: Part a. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will fall and the price level will rise, because the increase in the price of oil raises input costs and causes the short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the left.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will fall and the price level will rise, because the increase in the price of oil raises input costs and causes the short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the left.

Earns 1 point

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will fall and the price level will rise, because the increase in the price of oil raises input costs and causes the short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the left.

title: Part b. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will rise and the price level will fall, because the increase in labor productivity reduces unit input costs and causes the short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will rise and the price level will fall, because the increase in labor productivity reduces unit input costs and causes the short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right.

Earns 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will rise and the price level will fall, because the increase in labor productivity reduces unit input costs and causes the short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right.

title: Part c. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will rise and the price level will rise, because the increase in spending causes the aggregate demand curve to shift to the right.
descriptions:
No point earned

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will rise and the price level will rise, because the increase in spending causes the aggregate demand curve to shift to the right.

Earns 1 point

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will rise and the price level will rise, because the increase in spending causes the aggregate demand curve to shift to the right.

title: Part d. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will rise and the price level will rise, because the depreciation of the currency will cause net exports to rise and the aggregate demand curve to shift to the right.
descriptions:
No point earned

One point is earned for stating that real GDP will rise and the price level will rise, because the depreciation of the currency will cause net exports to rise and the aggregate demand curve to shift to the right.

Earns 1 point
